ATE level failure triage and debug across silicon

column1: The Position Will Have The Following Responsibility
Expertise in specific/multiple test module such as ATPG
Develop pre silicon validation test plan (in partnership with design) and post silicon test plan.
Be the voice from post silicon team to sign off the required test coverage quality that meets the DPPM goal.
Pre silicon simulation of test content usage model and how it gets integrated into ATE flow at wafer and package level.
Developing ATE test methods and characterization for test modules.
Analyzing test data to identify test program or silicon issues and working with cross functional teams to root cause will also be a focus.
ATE level failure triage and debug across silicon
Define and build failure analysis fault isolation capabilities for new IP/product.
Knowledge of system level test is a plus especially when dealing with System level test (SLT) failures and correlation of SLT with ATE test quality.

column1: The Responsibilities For This Position Include

The UAWeb Administrator provides access management support to critical SAP and Non-SAP applications in {company}. The UAWeb Administrator is responsible for daily activities related to user support and application support for access management to partner applications connected with UAWeb.
Monitor all UAWeb queues for SAP Security support.
Support all Service Now Incidents and Changes
Monitor UAWeb Dashboard monitoring tool and advise UAWeb Team/Customer of defects to user Off-Boarding or Continued Business Need processes.
Inform Customers of changes to service
Work with UAWeb Team to Create new UAWeb pages for customer
Set up UAWeb SID configuration (connection to hosts)
Perform Employment Verification and Continued Business Need processes as required.
Meet with UAWeb and Customer Teams to learn processes
Evaluate required changes within customer processes
Assist UAWeb Development Team where needed.
Perform application health check and data analysis
Create application reports and user analysis summaries
Excellent organization and communication skills - Ability to effectively communicate with the customer (verbal and written skills).
Must be a good team player and detail oriented.
Skilled in using good judgment to resolve or escalate problems or issues.
Ability to support US Eastern time zone working hours.
Be available to handle off shift work and communicate to the customer and Team members concerning work completed.
Ability to produce accurate process/procedural documentation.
Perform user testing for application changes.
Familiar with performing SAP health checks using UAWeb and manual checks
Provide SAP information (table data etc.) & other expertise during audits.
Familiar with Continued Business Need & Employment Verification Processes
Experience with SAP Security Administration & Controls concepts
